data.title: Our Interns — BERKELEY PHARMA TECH
data.text:
University of California, Davis

Class of 2025

Neurology, Physiology, and Behavior Major

Recent Achievement: “In my last quarter, I made the Dean's List, despite having one of the most difficult schedules of my college education. I was able to do well while also balancing my extracurriculars, which included being an active leader on the Women's Club Waterpolo team, working as an Emergency Medical Technician every weekend, and studying for the MCAT. In addition, I wrote a couple pieces in my health writing class which I was proud of and submitted to a prized writing contest and began an internship at UC Davis Health working with the pediatric population!”

University of California, Santa Cruz

Class of 2025

Molecular Cell Development

Recent Achievement: “A recent achievement of mine over the past few weeks is learning new and challenging cooking and baking recipes. Another recent achievement of mine has been getting the continuous opportunity to work in a small coffee shop during school breaks. It has been a great experience getting to learn the scientific parts of coffee as well as getting to work in a great group of coworkers, and learning good customer service. When I finish school I hope to attend medical school or work in medical research to try and help make people feel better.”

University of California, Berkeley

Class of 2024

Psychology and Public Major

Recent Achievement: “A recent achievement of mine was having the opportunity to lead a group in developing a digital resource to help guide first generation students through the process of applying to and transitioning into college. This was a project that resonated deeply with me as the first in my family to attend college myself. Furthermore, I was recently selected to train and volunteer at a non-profit clinic that focuses on providing free care to individuals and communities who are socioeconomically marginalized or excluded by the current healthcare system.”

University of Washington

Class of 2023

History Major

Recent Achievements: “An achievement I am proud of is overcoming my nerves about conversing in Italian and Spanish with native speakers. During my time studying in Europe, I connected with people from various regions and linguistic backgrounds who were similarly eager to communicate. Our shared goals of personal growth and international connection encouraged me to jump in and prioritize my language development (while also prioritizing my studies, an internship, and research & club activities.) Transitioning from a structured classroom to the dynamic real world was intimidating, exhilarating, and rewarding - even amidst the challenge of deciphering various dialects. Now, not only can I communicate more colloquially, but I also foster meaningful connections with people who broaden my global and personal perspectives.”

University of Wisconsin-Madison

Class of 2024

Master’s in Biotechnology

Recent Achievements: “Some of my recent achievements are firstly getting some good internships for the fall semester, completing a year of my grad school, and learning so much about responsibilities and growing up. Most importantly during my previous role in Regulatory Affairs, being something that takes years of practice, I gauged interest and passion in such a short span, I gained skills of leadership and confidence to take up any work. I've excelled at giving good presentations in all my school work. I've gained more insights and recognition of my strengths and capabilities, leading to self-care and appreciation in the last few months where I am regularly exercising and keeping fit.”

University of California, Berkeley

Class of 2026

Major: Molecular and Cellular Biology

About Me: “Hi! My name is Michelle Li, and I am part of the Class of 2026 as a freshman at the University of California, Berkeley. I am intending to major in Molecular and Cell Biology. I enjoy practicing Hapkido and hope to obtain my second degree black belt certification during or after college. I also deeply enjoy jamming out to Kpop music (preferably Seventeen and The Boyz), and am passionate about exploring the field of biomedicine, biotech, research, and bio-entrepreneurship. One fun fact about myself is that I am currently trying to make my dorm room Seventeen aesthetic-themed.”

Recent Achievements: “In terms of recent achievements, I am proud to have received my 1st degree black belt certification back in February of 2022. During the summer, I was able to dedicate many hours in volunteering at my local Hapkido studio. A while back, I was able to learn about bio entrepreneurship and pharmaceutics under the KECK Graduate Institute SURE Program, where I was able to analyze research articles to propose whether Ebselen could be used to treat Staphylococcal Infections. This experience caused me to fall in love with medicine even further.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I hope to have graduated with a double major in MCB and Business Administration. I hope to either be starting my first year at medical school to pursue a higher degree in order to prepare for a future career in medicine. Another aspiration in the next five years, if not medical school, would be me starting my first year at a biotech industry. I would achieve these aspirations through actively participating in research and work experience, while maintaining a learning mindset.”

University of California, Berkeley

Class of 2024

Major: Molecular & Cell Biology and Psychology

About Me: “Hi I am Jane, a junior at UC Berkeley majoring in Molecular & Cell Biology and Psychology. I love visiting coffee shops, cooking with my friends, and reading. One fun fact about me is that I have 2 cats who are in China and 1 cat that I adopted with my cousin who is at my cousin's place.”

Recent Achievements: “Recently I troubleshooted and overcame a challenge that I've been experiencing for about 2 months in my lab at Berkeley.”

Aspirations: “Five years from now, I would still be in grad school pursuing a Ph.D. degree.”

Purdue University

Class of 2026

Major: Computer Information Technology

About Me: “My name is Deepak Ananthakrishnan and I am a freshman attending Purdue University this fall. My passions involve messing with computers and watching or playing sports in my spare time. One fun fact about myself is that I've played the piano for seven years.”

Recent Achievements: “An achievement I'm proud of is that I got all the way to Certificate of Merit level 9 right when I graduated high school. Additionally, I am proud that I was able to successfully achieve a third degree black belt in Taekwondo.”

Aspirations: “ In five years I see myself not only working a technology based job that I would find interesting, but also following my passions as well. Whether it comes from through my job or in my own time, I see myself analyzing and playing sports for fun. I plan to achieve this goal by not only hard work, but also trying to do projects that connect sports and technology in my own time as well.”

Case Western Reserve University

Class of 2023

Major: Computer Science

About Me: “Hi, my name is Kaitao Chen. I am a senior student at Case Western Reserve University. My major is Computer Science and my main study field is software engineering.”

Recent Achievements: “I have completed two Unity game design projects over two semesters in 2021 and have uploaded the final product to itch.io for public viewing. My first project, Slash and Burn, gave me a deeper understanding of zombie games. The second project is called Trunko, which is a 2D side-scrolling roguelike game. Acting as Trunko, you must navigate and fight your way through three floors of enemies, picking up weapons and upgrades along the way, to earn your freedom and return to space. Moreover, I am still working on an HTML game called 2048. The game adopts the most standard web design of HTML+CSS+Javascript. And use Vuetify for front-end UI design to make the whole game look better.”

Aspirations: “After five years, I want to continue developing in the game design field and seek a more senior position for myself. I think game design must be a very hot industry within five years. With the popularization of artificial intelligence and virtual reality, if game design is integrated into it, it will inevitably change how people entertain. I think this internship allowed me to learn new skills, and this one can help me improve myself.”

Cornell University

Class of 2025

Major: Industrial and Labor Relations

About Me: “My name is Audrey Chan and I am a sophomore at Cornell University studying Industrial and Labor Relations. In my free time, I love reading, hiking, and trying out various matcha drinks. One fun fact about myself is that tangerines are my favorite fruit!”

Recent Achievements: “A recent achievement that I am proud of is that I was team captain of Cal Fencing in Sabre. After training novices from fall through spring semester, our team traveled to Rhode Island for CFC nationals and won first place.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself completing my undergraduate degree and working in the consulting industry. I hope to pursue a law degree after a while, either in entertainment or employment law.”

University of California, Irvine

Class of 2024

Major: Biomedical Engineering

About Me: “My name is Ashley Varatip and I am a third year undergraduate student at the University of California, Irvine majoring in Biomedical Engineering. Outside of academics, I enjoy working out, playing volleyball, and trying new foods. One fun fact about me is that I love traveling and I recently just went to Thailand for the fifth time this summer.”

Recent Achievements: “I was selected as one of the few students to obtain an undergraduate research position in the Cardiovascular Modeling Laboratory at UCI. Here, I will be researching the effect of different stimuli, such as hypoxia and cytokine, present in diseases on cardiac structure and function.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself obtaining an undergraduate degree in Biomedical Engineering at UCI. Furthermore, I want to be in the process of getting my PhD. I want to be in a position where I have gained more experience and knowledge in this field. My overall goal would be to use my research and laboratory skills to work as a biotech researcher and be able to help my community. I plan to achieve this by always being a hard worker when it comes to coursework and research.”

University of California, Berkeley

Class of 2025

Major: Molecular Environmental Biology and Nutritional Science

About Me: “My name is Emma Son, and I am a Sophomore at UC Berkeley, pursuing BS degrees in Molecular Environmental Biology and Nutritional Science. Some of my passions include playing the flute, swimming, and graphic design. One fun fact about me is that I love teaching and working with children.”

Recent Achievements: “Some achievements I am proud of includes holding leadership positions in three clubs in my university, including a club focusing on distributing medical supplies to impoverished communities. Because I am passionate about Nutritional science, I drafted and published an eating disorder awareness pamphlet for my high school district. Additionally, I founded and led a class for reading classes for underprivileged ESL students. I also founded an student-run organization focusing on physical and mental wellbeing, focusing on social media publicity to raise awareness in students. Additionally, I created a fundraiser in partnership with UNICEF to donate money towards global education, funded by an online business that I started and ran selling handmade jewelry.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself graduating with my double degrees and working in biological research. I hope to continue working in a lab setting, discovering and experimenting with new theories in the biomedical field, and its correlation with increasingly technological methods.”

University of California, San Diego

Class of 2024

Major: Biology

About Me: “My name is Sofya Svyatskaya, but I go by Sonya. I am currently a rising junior at the University of California San Diego. Some of my passions include fitness, fashion, many different out door activities, working with/meeting new people. One fun fact about me is that I worked as a ski instructor.”

Recent Achievements: “Some of my recent achievements was learning how to surf, hence getting over my immense fear of the ocean, getting a lab position within the UCSD Medical School and getting more involved in it over times, as well as getting a volunteer position at UCSD Medical Center.”

Aspirations: “In five years I hope be doing something that I love, well I hope I at least figure out what it is. Right now all my interests are in the same frame work of biology and medicine, but I don't know if I want to take the medical school route or look more into biotech.”

Dougherty Valley High School

Class of 2027

Major: Interested in Human Biology and Art/Design

About Me: “I'm Darshita Prathap, a senior at Dougherty Valley High School. I absolutely love working with kids, whether that's tutoring or even just playing with them. Fun fact: I have 7 guitars (all of which I play for my youtube channel).”

Recent Achievements: “I'm extremely proud of my American Cancer Society club for growing in the most diverse and communal of ways after the pandemic. We just had our first relay for life since the pandemic, and I was our opening speaker. I'm also proud of the synthetic chem research I've presented at the American Chemical Society.”

Aspirations: “Five years from now, I'll have finished my undergrad doubling majoring in Human biology and Art/Design. I'm currently developing a project to create therapeutic art for children with Autism and hope to expand that with my research experience at Berkeley Pharma Tech.”

University of California, Los Angeles

Class of 2023

Major: Molecular Cell and Developmental Biology

About Me: “Hi everyone! My name is Kylie McCauley, and I am a senior at UCLA. I spend my time reading, playing tennis, golfing, and surfing, as well as working in a UCLA research lab. A fun fact about me is that I swam and played water polo for five years.”

Recent Achievements: “During my time at UCLA, I have been involved in several campus organizations, including serving as the president of a philanthropic women's organization with over 200 members. Through my research postion at a UCLA neuroscience laboratory, I am a co-author of several works submitted to a neuroscience conference and two medical journals. During the pandemic, I worked in a COVID-19 testing lab, processing and running thousands of tests daily while gaining insight into how a commercial lab operates.”

Aspirations: “My career goals include either persuing a medical degree, or working as a leader within the biotechnology industry to not only develop a life-changing product but also direct and make decisions on behalf of the company. Ultimately, I aim to have a positive impact on improving health care, and working with companies like Berkeley PharmaTech will help me to gain experience and network with individuals who can make my career dreams a reality.”

University of Chicago

Class of 2025

Major: Chemistry

About Me: “My name is Isis Decrem and I am a sophomore at the University of Chicago. I love science, but am also passionate about innovation and political issues. I have not declared a major, but am learning towards Chemistry. In my free time, I enjoy going on walks, surfing, and hanging out with friends. Additionally, I usually have a miscellaneous side project going on– these can be anything from learning about mindfulness to making a series of paintings.”

Recent Achievements: “My current side project is creating an app. As of today, the most basic version of the app is fully functional. While it is really rewarding to see everything come to life on my phone, what really makes me happy is knowing how much I’ve learned. I haven’t coded anything of this scale by myself before, and in this process, have learned how to “do” so many things that future projects will need.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself at a startup working at the intersection of science and computer technology. I would love to be at a biotech startup working on something I am particularly passionate about, such as women’s health or mental health issues. To get here, I plan to build a strong research background, and spend time interning at both large and small companies. I have always been interested in going to graduate school, so that is in the cards, as well.”

Boston University

Class of 2024

Major: Biology

About Me: “My name is Cameron, and I am a junior at Boston University. My major is Biology with a specialization in Cellular Biology, Molecular Biology & Genetics (CMG). Outside of academics, I enjoy being active, whether it is running, biking, swimming or going to the gym. A fun fact about me is that I did Variety Bowling for one winter season in high school.”

Recent Achievements: “Last year, I co-founded the Boston University Blockchain club and have started an engaged cryptocurrency community at my college. The e-board and I are continuing to grow the club as well as the club’s network with blockchain related companies and organizations.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself gaining a few years of professional work experience in the healthcare industry. I would also like to pursue a master’s degree in either Public Health or Biology.”

Mission San Jose High School

Class of 2027

Major: Interested in Biological and Neural Engineering

About Me: “I am a senior at Mission San Jose High School and an aspiring humanitarian biomedical engineer. Born and raised in Fremont, California, I have travelled to over 21 countries. I believe that to change the world for the better, I must start in my own community. My hobbies include writing blogs on neuroscience, playing guitar and cooking with my little brother (pasta is our favorite). One fun fact about me is I practice Guardian Art (from indigenous heritage martial art).”

Recent Achievements: “Recent achievements that I am proud of is I got an AP Scholar with distinction award and was selected to be a Youth Wellness Ambassador for the City of Fremont.”

Aspirations: “I believe in the power of socially responsible biomedical engineering to help solve pressing challenges of our times, including global health inequality. I can’t wait to join Engineers Without Borders. As a graduate student, I aspire to pursue neural engineering to help find solutions to neurological diseases.”

University of California, Berkeley

Class of 2024

Major: Molecular Environmental Biology

About Me: “Hello! My name is Kelly An and I am a third year studying Molecular Environmental Biology with an emphasis in Environment and Human Health and minor in Nutritional Sciences. I am very passionate about food, staying active, and trying new things! A fun fact about me is that I never order the same thing twice at a restaurant, cafe, or boba shop.”

Recent Achievements: “I enjoyed the opportunity to present a project that I have been assisting with at UCSF at a research showcase for my college at UC Berkeley. I am excited to take on this position as BPT's medical research intern. I have also completed a personal summer goal of being able to do at least one pull up!”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself as a medical student, pursuing a career as an effective physician. On this journey, I will stay dedicated to my studies and learn from the research opportunities I engage in. I will focus on building more skills to be an empathetic and reliable doctor through clinical and volunteer experiences I will engage in. My passion for medicine, health, and wellbeing drives my aspirations to be an impactful individual.”

Loyola University Chicago

Class of 2025

Major: Biology

About Me: “My name is Jillian Popovich, and I am a sophomore Biology student at Loyola University Chicago. I am passionate about showing representation of disability in medicine and biomedical research, and making quality healthcare more accessible to groups who are historically disadvantaged. One fun fact about me is that I graduated high school after only three years!”

Recent Achievements: “Some recent achievements I am proud of include obtaining this research internship, writing a research paper about the ethics behind the use of CRISPR, being offered the Presidential Scholarship from my school, and completing my first year of college in a big new city. I am also very proud of myself for having finished 41 credits by the end of my freshman year, along with my GPA that followed those classes.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself with a B.S. in Biology, and attending medical school, hopefully somewhere in Chicago. I plan on achieving this by continuing to apply my knowledge to my studies, growing the knowledge I already have, and staying focused on things that will further accelerate my path to graduate school, such as this internship.”

University of Michigan

Class of 2025

Major: Biomedical Engineering

About Me: “I am Jordyn Novick a Freshman studying biomedical engineering at the University of Michigan. Some of my passions include dancing, traveling, and baking. A fun fact is that my roommate and I currently have a pet fish in our dorm!”

Recent Achievements: “A recent achievement that I am proud of is making the Dean's list for first semester. I worked really hard in all of my classes as well as adjusted really well to college life.”

Aspirations: “After graduation, I hope to be part of a collaborative team undertaking cutting-edge research in tissue engineering and/or artificial organ creation. After gaining clinical experience, I would like to attend graduate school to advance my knowledge in the field of biomedical engineering to create revolutionary devices that improve human health.”

UC Irvine

Class of 2024

Major: Biomedical Engineering

About Me: “My name is Donna Tran, and I am a second-year student pursuing a Biomedical Engineering B.S. degree at the University of California, Irvine. I am passionate about bridging the realms of medicine and engineering by developing innovative solutions to challenges in the MedTech industry. I also enjoy tutoring and sharing my knowledge with the next generation of bright scholars. A fun fact about myself is that I have double-jointed knuckles.”

Recent Achievements: “I recently obtained an undergraduate research position at the Microbiomechanics Lab at UCI where I will be exploring hippocampal in vitro electrophysiology. I will apply my experience with coding and data analysis to study neural networks in the hippocampus.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I envision myself having already graduated with a Biomedical Engineering, B.S. and gaining experience at a biotech company. During this time, I also hope to specialize in a branch of BME that I am most passionate about by pursing a higher degree.”

UC Berkeley

Class of 2024

Major: Molecular and Cell Biology

About Me: “My name is Anna Pollini and I am a second-year at the University of California, Berkeley. My major is Molecular and Cell Biology with a concentration in Biochemistry. I am really passionate about my field of study, but I also have many other interests and hobbies including dance, art, photography, reading, and journaling. One fun fact about me is that I am from New Jersey and I am really interested in pursuing a business degree on top of my current major.”

Recent Achievements: “Some of my recent achievements that I am proud of include running a successful small business and social media account on tik tok. I really love working with big brands for marketing opportunities and it is one of my favorite activities. I am also proud of being a student here at Berkeley and being successful in my courses because I put a lot of effort into my academics and am happy to see positive results.”

Aspirations: “In five years I see myself in a PhD program pursuing a degree in the biomedical field. After finishing school, I hope to work in an innovative biotechnology company. I plan to achieve this goal by being successful in my coursework and also making an effort to participate in research both on and off-campus.”

University of Pittsburgh

Class of 2025

Major: Bioengineering

About Me: “Academically and professionally I am very passionate about medicine, healthcare and science. I would like my job in the future to be something in which I am able to make a positive impact on people. Outside of this, I love to dance, paint, spend time with my friends and family and randomly learn songs on the piano. One funfact about me is that I love to travel, and one of my favorite experiences was cliff diving in Jamaica.”

Recent Achievements: “Some of my most recent achievements was obtaining my EMT certification. Additionally I recently started to learn under a PI in a research lab in Pittsburgh that I will be working in over the school year to get more experience.”

Aspirations: “In 5 years I would have finished my undergrad degree in bioengineering and would like to be doing one of two things. I would either be pursuing further education in the form of an MD or an MSE/MBA, otherwise I would like to work in the clinical bioengineering industry. My overall goal in life is to work in the medical/healthcare field, and help the community around me. I plan to do this by using these next few years to figure out how I best fit into this field, and where I would be able to work the best to make the biggest impact.”

University of Connecticut

Class of 2023

Major: Molecular and Cell Biology

About Me: “Matt Gostkowski, Class of 2023, University of Connecticut, molecular and cell biology major. Some of my passions/hobbies include sports, listening to music, outdoor activities like fishing, biking, hiking. One fun fact about me is that I am a huge soccer fan.”

Recent Achievements: “Some recent achievements that I am proud of include earning a 2020 Babbidge Scholar award and reaching my fundraising goal for HuskyTHON 2022 at UConn.”

Aspirations: “In 5 years I hope to be pursuing a career as a physician or working in a biomedical research role. My goal is to pursue further education in medicine and gain experience biomedical research in the next few years to set myself up for a career where I feel like my work is having a positive impact on the others. I believe my passion in the biomedical field and experience I plan to gain will help me be successful in achieving my goal.”

University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign

Class of 2024

Major: Molecular and Cellular Biology

About Me: “My name is Sanjana Satish, and I am a sophomore studying Molecular and Cellular Biology at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. Outside of academics, I love to dance and play the piano. I also love to swim and play tennis when the weather is nice outside. Additionally, I enjoy traveling to different countries and have visited eight countries so far. One fun fact is that I got to travel to Poland with a Holocaust survivor where I visited different concentration camps and historical sites with her!”

Recent Achievements: “A while back, I was selected for the McLean County Cadaver Lab program where I got to dissect a cadaver and interact with surgeons, histologists, nurses, medical researchers, and other healthcare professionals. Recently, I got a chance to shadow and interact closely with a pediatrician and optometrist and joined the Cellular Neuroscience and Imaging Lab on campus.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself with a degree in Biology and a secondary discipline in Bioengineering. I hope to be in medical school and gaining more experience in the healthcare field.”

Dartmouth College

Class of 2023

Major: Biology

About Me: “My name is Anyoko Sewavi and I am in the Class of 2023 at Dartmouth College. I enjoy reading science fiction books as well as cooking. One fun fact about me is that I am a bingo fanatic.”

Recent Achievements: “I am an E.E Just Undergraduate Fellow which allows me to pursue an independent research project during my junior and senior year.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I will be a biology/genetics PhD student and continue my journey as a scientist. I plan to achieve this by working hard during my undergrad years with classes and research to make myself a competitive applicant.”

UC Berkeley

Class of 2024

Major: Chemical Engineering

About Me: “My name is Jason, and I am a second-year chemical engineering major at UC Berkeley. In my free time, I enjoy coaching club basketball and cooking. One fun fact about me is that I religiously take a nap every day.”

Recent Achievements: “As a member of the corporate committee at my school’s chapter of the American Institute of Chemical Engineers, I recently hosted an interview-style event where alumni led mock interviews with students. I was also invited to Tau Beta Pi, an engineering honors society at Berkeley.”

Aspirations: “In 5 years, I see myself having completed a master’s program in chemical engineering and starting a Ph.D. program or entering into the industry, working for a biotech company. With more experience, I plan to decide what sub-field of research I want to pursue through education or work. Regardless, I hope to be on the cutting edge of pharmaceutical research.”

Santa Clara University

Class of 2025

Major: Biology

About Me: “My name is Pragnya Vijayan and I am a freshman at Santa Clara University. I am majoring in Biology and minoring in Computer Science. In my free time, I enjoy reading, hiking, and going on car rides. A fun fact about me is that I have never broken a bone.”

Recent Achievements: “In my current internship at 1Cademy, an online-collaborative platform built by the University of Michigan School of Information to promote interdisciplinary research, I abstract literature in the fields of neuroscience and psychology and perform content mapping. I am also a writer for the SCU Her Campus chapter and publish articles about college experience and lifestyle.”

Aspirations: “My ambition is to transform the lives of people by identifying gaps between healthcare delivery and current medical technology. In five years, I hope to be working as a biomedical engineer and envision integrating myself into high-focus research and design areas. I am interested in studying biomaterials for tissue engineering and reversing the progression of diseases. Alternatively, I plan on pursuing an MD/Ph.D to build a foundation for tackling medical challenges.”

University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign

Class of 2023

Major: Molecular and Cellular Biology & Informatics

About Me: “Hi! I'm Ethan. I am a junior studying molecular and cellular biology and informatics at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. Outside of school, I enjoy playing tennis, lifting, or playing the guitar.

Recent Achievements: “Recently, I made the dean's list as well as obtained my Pharmacy Technician license, both of which I am very proud of.”

Aspirations: “In 5 years, I see myself graduating either med school or graduate school in some type of computational neuroscience field. My experiences in the classroom and in this internship will be very helpful as I am on that journey.”

Stanford University

Class of 2025

Major: Bioengineering

About Me: “My name is Belinda Yeung, and I am a freshman at Stanford University. I love trying new foods and photography. One fun fact about me is that my favorite medium of photography is 35mm film.”

Recent Achievements: “One recent activity that I am proud of is that I volunteered at a bone marrow drive.”

Aspirations: “In the next five years, I hope to be continuing biomedical research. I hope that I can use what I learn to make a meaningful impact for others.”

UC Berkeley

Class of 2025

Major: Molecular and Cellular Biology

About Me: “Hi, my name is Tanvi Yalamanchili, and I am a rising sophomore in UC Berkeley, intending to major in Molecular and Cellular Biology with an emphasis in Immunology and Pathogenesis. I really love baking/cooking, playing tennis, and watching Indian movies. One fun fact about me is that I know how to make seven different ice cream flavors.”

Recent Achievements: “I recently wrote a scientific review article called "Autophagy: A Multipotentialite" and got it published under the biology section in the Young Scientists' Journal. It addresses how autophagy, a multicellular process, could be used as a potential therapeutic for COVID-19.”

Aspirations: “I am planning to go the pre-med track, so in five years, I see myself being in my first year of med school and hope to be an OB-GYN in the future. I plan on achieving my goal by getting involved in research, working hard in school, and finding opportunities to volunteer at hospitals or clinics and shadow different healthcare professionals.”

UC Santa Cruz

Class of 2024

Major: Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology

About Me: “Hi! My name is Saahil, and I am a rising junior at UC Santa Cruz studying Molecular, Cellular, and Developmental Biology. Some of my hobbies include spending time outdoors, rock climbing, and listening to podcasts, and one fun fact about me is that I have an (almost) 2-year-old golden retriever that I trained myself!”

Recent Achievements: “An achievement that I am proud of is that I recently got accepted into, and have begun doing research in, an immunology lab on campus. Our lab studies the regulation of immune responses in disease by MHC molecules (which are crucial for the function of the adaptive immune system). I also became a co-president of an on-campus organization that seeks to establish and operate a shelter for students who may be homeless; I am looking forward to coming up with solutions that can address the needs of the unhoused student population.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I see myself in medical school, pursuing a MD degree, on a path to becoming a physician. One of my long-term goals is to give back to my community in an impactful way while addressing disparities in health and medicine that are experienced by traditionally marginalized populations and groups.”

University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign

Class of 2024

Major: Engineering Physics

About Me: “Hi! I am Ishita Purwar, a rising junior at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. I am an Engineering Physics, and naturally, I love Math and Physics. I also have a huge knack for Biochemistry and Psychology; I think that they are really interesting. One fun fact about me is that I am really short and young for a normal college student.”

Recent Achievements: “I have been the choreographer of the Bollywood dance group at my University for one year. I have been on the Dean's List of UIUC Grainger College of Engineering for 4 consecutive semesters.”

Aspirations: “I see myself in the healthcare industry, with better interpersonal skills and communication skills. I want to be on the engineering side of biotechnology. For this to happen, I would like to do a master's in Public Health or Bioengineering.”

University of Texas at Dallas

Class of 2024

Major: Molecular Biology

About Me: “Venkata Repaka is an undergraduate student at the University of Texas at Dallas, majoring in Molecular Biology and minoring in neurobiology with an expected graduation date of May 2024. She is passionate about becoming an MD/Ph.D. within the oncology and genetics departments. A fun fact about her is that she loves reptiles and owns a pet tortoise.”

Recent Achievements: “Venkata is proud of her achievement in presenting her college research from Dr. Douglas Root's lab at the 2021 ASBMB North Texas Regional Conference. She is also happy to be with Berkeley Pharma Tech as a Medical Research Intern for her fourth semester and hopes to build her research background.”

Aspirations: “In five years, Venkata hopes to be attending an MD/Ph.D. program and do great research for others. Currently, she is conducting research at her university and in BPT to build the backbone for her career while gaining clinical experience on the side.”

UC Berkeley

Class of 2025

Major: Molecular and Cell Biology & Business Administration

About Me: “Kia ora! I'm Christina (Yu Qing) and I am a rising sophomore at UC Berkeley. Some of my passions include content creation, reading, and photography. One fun fact about me is that I have a twin brother called Dennis, who is currently studying in Beijing, China.”

Recent Achievements: “The spring semester of 2022 was pretty hectic for me! I came into college a little unsure of what I wanted to pursue so I tried to get involved in various activities. One of the most rewarding activities I participated in was being an apprentice at an optometry lab on campus: SELAB. I met a lot of amazing people and learned more about the scientific process, specifically in terms of human subject testing. I was also involved with a consulting club in Phi Beta Lambda, where I was challenged to think critically and solve problems creatively.”

Aspirations: “In five years, I want to be a passionate scientist who is eager to drive innovation that has the potential to positively change the world. I hope to pursue higher education, potentially a MD-PhD to initiate a career as a changemaker in the healthcare space. I am equally passionate about becoming a physician, where I can directly impact patients’ lives, or a biotech researcher, where I can utilise my endless curiosity to find solutions to medical problems. I want to be a leader for the people, and make the healthcare system more equitable for the people in my community.”

Dougherty Valley High School

HS Junior

About Me: “My name is Harrison Xu, and I am a junior in Dougherty Valley Highs school. I love science, but I also love music! I play multiple types of saxophones and perform in multiple jazz bands. On top of that, I enjoy recreationally singing and performing in talent shows. One fun fact about myself is that I love playing soccer recreationally and in a competitive team.”

Recent Achievements: “I have taken initiative and led many research groups. An example of this is our andrographolide subgroup, where I significantly contribute to this subgroup’s progress: I am the main contributor to the project of andrographolide extraction from plant powders, synthesis of an andrographolide stereoisomer, and purification of andrographolide analogs to test bioavailability on cancer cells. Besides andrographolide, I am also in other subgroups: the neuroscience group; where we create analogs of compounds rivastigmine and vinpocetine to test their effectiveness at treating Alzheimer’s and Parkinson’s, the total synthesis group; where we are creating a more accessible pathway of totally synthesizing the cyclotripeptide Psychrophilin E, and the ADCs group; where we make antibody-drug conjugates with a variety of drugs to see their effectiveness in treating certain cancers.”

Aspirations: “In five years into the future, I see myself in college pursuing an undergraduate degree following a subject related to biomedical engineering or chemical biology. I would finish my undergraduate years and look for an industry job where I can work on medicinal synthesis and scientific research. I would like to explore the translational research world, so I would also look into finding more scientific opportunities that would give me a broader perspective of how research of different types would be like.”
